etymologies: early 17th century (denoting a particular fashion in drinking): from earlier crambe ‘cabbage’, used figuratively to denote something distasteful that is repeated, apparently from Latin crambe repetita ‘cabbage served up again’, applied by Juvenal to any distasteful repetition

definitions: a game in which a player gives a word or line of verse to which each of the other players must find a rhyme.
shortDefinitions: game in which player gives word or line of verse to which each of other players must find rhyme
